directions: Trim the stems and, if necessary, remove the strings from the sugar snap peas. To check if strings are present, cut or snap off a stem and then pull downward the length of the pod.
Arrange the sugar snap peas in a steamer rack set over boiling water, cover and steam until tender-crisp, about 3 minutes.
Transfer the peas to a serving bowl and add the green onions, sesame oil, sesame seeds and salt. Toss to coat the peas evenly. Serve warm or at room temperature. Serves 4.
, by Mary Abbott Hess, Dana Jacobi & Marie Simmons (Oxmoor House, 2003).
ingredients: 2 green onions, white and light green portions, cut into slices 1/4 inch thick
title: Steamed Sugar Snap Peas with Black Sesame Seeds
